Crawler User wrote:
> hi all.   I am interested in disabling some portions of the build 
> process to make incremental development builds complete faster.
> 
> I have been able to skip the unit tests by using this option:
>    maven dist -Dmaven.test.skip=true
> 
> However, I'd also really like to be able to skip the 
> javadoc/docbook/xdoc portions of the build.

The core team tends to use Eclipse, and thus local launches with new 
code (and when debugging, sometimes even injecting new code to an 
already-running JVM) doesn't require an explicit build.

Supplying the JVM argument "-Dheritrix.development", on a launch from 
within a 'heritrix' project checkout root directory, and specifying the 
main class "org.archive.crawler.Heritrix" is typically all that's required.

(With the "-Dheritrix.development" argument, the output usually captured 
into heritrix_out.log will go to the console, and it will find the 
necessary web-UI and other configuration file from the project 'src' 
subdirectory, instead of usual-build locations.)

Something similar should be possible in other IDEs or debugging 
environments.

If you still need an abbreviated build for other reasons, you might be 
able to disable various doc-building steps with edits to the project.xml 
or project.properties files.

- Gordon @ IA
